skill.name: seo-handler
skill.description: Manage SEO, sitemaps, and metadata for optimal search engine visibility
skill.summary: Manage SEO, sitemaps, and metadata for optimal search engine visibility
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with SEO guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own documentation. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Optimize Next.js SEO for search engines
content.value_statement: Search engines struggle to index poorly configured websites. This skill provides clear patterns for Next.js sitemaps, metadata, JSON-LD structured data, and robots.txt to maximize search visibility and improve rankings.
actual_capabilities: Generate sitemap.ts files for static and dynamic routes
Configure metadata with inheritance patterns in layout.tsx and page.tsx
Add JSON-LD structured data using next-seo components
Set up robots.txt to control crawler access
Implement Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) for content pages
limitations: Only supports Next.js App Router projects
Does not generate SEO content or meta descriptions
Cannot analyze existing SEO performance or suggest improvements
Requires manual integration of code examples into your project

use_cases.title: Configure sitemaps and metadata
use_cases.description: Set up proper sitemap.ts, metadata exports, and OpenGraph tags for new Next.js projects

use_cases.title: Add structured data
use_cases.description: Implement JSON-LD schemas for articles, products, and FAQ pages using next-seo components

use_cases.title: Control crawler access
use_cases.description: Configure robots.txt to disallow private routes and optimize crawl budget usage

prompt_templates.title: Basic sitemap setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Add /pricing to the sitemap in src/app/sitemap.ts following the seo-handler pattern

prompt_templates.title: Metadata inheritance
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a blog post page with proper metadata inheritance and OpenGraph images

prompt_templates.title: Structured data
prompt_templates.prompt: Add ArticleJsonLd component to a blog post page with proper schema.org markup

prompt_templates.title: ISR optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure ISR for a documentation page that updates hourly with generateStaticParams

output_examples.input: Add structured data for a product page
output: Required fields: name, description, image, offers (price, availability)
Added to page with useAppDir prop for Next.js 13+
Wrapped in Suspense for async data fetching

best_practices: Define base metadata in layout.tsx and override only what changes in individual pages
Include all public routes in sitemap.ts to ensure full indexing coverage
Use ISR with appropriate revalidate times to balance freshness and performance
anti_patterns: Hardcoding URLs in metadata instead of using environment variables
Skipping robots.txt and exposing private API routes to crawlers
Forgetting to add new pages to sitemap.ts causing indexing gaps

faq.question: Does this skill work with Pages Router?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for Next.js App Router with the sitemap.ts and metadata patterns.

faq.question: How many URLs can a sitemap contain?
faq.answer: Sitemaps support up to 50,000 URLs. Use generateSitemaps for larger sites with pagination.

faq.question: Can I use this with custom SEO libraries?
faq.answer: Yes, patterns are framework-agnostic but examples use next-seo as the recommended solution.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No, the skill provides code patterns and guidance. You apply changes using Write or Edit tools.

faq.question: Why use ISR instead of SSR for content?
faq.answer: ISR caches pages at the edge for better performance while still allowing periodic content updates.

faq.question: How is this different from other SEO tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Next.js-specific implementation patterns rather than generic SEO advice or audits.
